title: A couple got engaged as an intense storm brewed on the Jersey Shore and a news team was there to capture it
text:
NBC 4 New York reporters caught a couple's engagement on camera, while reporting on a storm at the Jersey Shore on Wednesday.

Amid strong winds and against a backdrop of a white-capped ocean, Tyler Osborne got down on one knee and proposed to Lisa Snyder. She said yes.

Reporter Brian Thompson interviewed the couple after the special moment. They both said they knew they would get married the second they met each other.

As reporters covered an impending storm at the Jersey Shore on Wednesday, they caught the heartwarming moment a man proposed to his girlfriend.

Amid gusting winds and a backdrop of a white-capped sea, NBC New York cameramen captured a man on the boardwalk getting down on one knee and pulling a ring out of his pocket to ask a woman to marry him.

After the woman said yes, reporter Brian Thompson went over and interviewed the newly-engaged couple, identified as Tyler Osborne and Lisa Snyder.

It was Snyder's 30th birthday and Osborne picked the boardwalk to pop the question since it's where they had their first kiss 15 months prior.

Both said that they knew they would get married from the first day they met.

"Since the second I met her. No doubt," Osborne said. "There was no doubt in my mind."
description: Tyler Osborne proposed to his girlfriend, Lisa Snyder, in the spot where they had their first kiss 15 months prior.
